## How to Make Crispy Butter Bean Tacos

::: {.fragment tts="Welcome to this delicious guide on making crispy butter bean tacos! These plant-based tacos are packed with flavor and have an amazing crispy texture that will satisfy any taco craving."}
Get ready to create amazing plant-based tacos with incredible texture and flavor!
:::

## Ingredients You'll Need

::: {.fragment tts="First, let's gather our ingredients. You'll need two cans of butter beans, also known as lima beans."}
- 2 cans butter beans (drained and rinsed)
:::

::: {.fragment tts="For seasoning, grab some cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and salt."}
- 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt to taste
:::

::: {.fragment tts="You'll also need corn tortillas, olive oil, and your favorite taco toppings like lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado."}
- 8 corn tortillas
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Toppings: lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, cilantro
:::

## Preparing the Crispy Butter Beans

::: {.fragment tts="Start by heating olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat."}
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
:::

::: {.fragment tts="Add the drained butter beans to the hot skillet. Let them cook without stirring for about 3 minutes to develop a crispy bottom."}
Add butter beans and cook undisturbed for 3 minutes
:::

::: {.fragment tts="Now sprinkle in your spices - cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and salt. Stir gently and continue cooking for another 4 to 5 minutes until the beans are golden and crispy on the outside."}
Add spices and cook 4-5 minutes until golden and crispy
:::

## Assembly and Serving

::: {.fragment tts="While the beans finish cooking, warm your corn tortillas in a dry skillet or directly over a gas flame for about 30 seconds per side."}
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet for 30 seconds per side
:::

::: {.fragment tts="Now comes the fun part - assembly! Fill each warm tortilla with the crispy seasoned butter beans."}
Fill tortillas with crispy seasoned butter beans
:::

::: {.fragment tts="Top with fresh lettuce, diced tomatoes, sliced avocado, and cilantro. Serve immediately while the beans are still warm and crispy. Enjoy your delicious homemade butter bean tacos!"}
Add fresh toppings and serve immediately while warm
:::
